titleStmt.title: Wiliey Adams and Malisa Baley to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9982

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your Petitioners Wiley Adams and Malisa Baley would represent to your excellency that at the last Term of the Floyd Circuit Court there was a fine assessed agt each of these Petitioners for the sum of $20.00 for the act of adultry these petitions further States that they were living in the County of Magoffin and had employed Council in the above Named Case and gave to the Said Council the names of their witnessess and relied on their Council to attend to their case and Said Council failed to appear when Said Case was tried and Judgt.. went against them by default and these Petitioners prayer your honor to remit Said fines
The undersigned Join in the prayer of the above named petitioners for the Remission of their fines

Isaac Mullins
stehen Arnett
